intro: Cochleariopsis groenlandica subsp. oblongifolia, commonly known as the Greenland bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This subspecies is notable for its resilience in harsh environments and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats.
